transportAdvice: Montevideo has an extensive bus network that covers most tourist areas and neighborhoods, making it a practical and affordable way to get around; taxis and remises (private hire cars) are widely available for shorter or more direct trips. The historic Ciudad Vieja and waterfront rambla are very walkable, and cycling infrastructure has expanded in recent years.

weather.description: Hot summer month with long sunny days and occasional brief thunderstorms; ideal beach weather.
Warm and sunny with conditions similar to January; one of the best months for outdoor activities.
Late summer brings slightly cooler evenings but still warm and pleasant days.
Autumn sets in with mild temperatures and increasing cloud cover; a comfortable time to explore the city.
Noticeably cooler with more frequent rain; a light jacket is needed, especially in the evenings.
Cool and often wet winter month with overcast skies; indoor cultural attractions become more appealing.
The coldest month of the year with frequent rain and wind; pack warm layers and a waterproof jacket.
Still cold and rainy but days begin to lengthen slightly toward the end of the month.
Early spring brings variable weather with warmer spells mixed with cool, windy days.
Pleasant spring temperatures with a mix of sunny and showery days; the city begins to feel lively again.
Warm and increasingly sunny; a great month to visit before the peak summer crowds arrive.
Hot early summer weather with long days; the rambla and beaches become popular gathering spots.
